conclusion: Analyze the paths of the liquid from points A, B, and C to determine which container it will flow into.
Liquid flows from A at the top left, through the black baffle, and heads downward.
Liquid flows from B at the top center, through the purple baffle, and heads downward.
Liquid flows from C at the top right, through the cyan baffle, and heads downward.
Liquid from A flows down the black baffle and continues straight down, likely reaching the area near container D.
Liquid from B flows down the purple baffle and continues straight down, likely reaching the area near container E.
Liquid from C flows down the cyan baffle and continues straight down, likely reaching the area near container F.
The path from A leads directly to container D.
The path from B leads directly to container E.
The path from C leads directly to container F.
Liquid from A, B, and C will flow into containers D, E, and F respectively.
